We use the power of media and storytelling to amplify ocean solutions. 
📍- 🇵🇦 aboard the #SeaLegacy1
Founders: @mitty, @paulnicklen, & @shawnheinrichs

node.text:
Together we can end the deadly use of driftnets in California once and for all. Sign the petition at the link in our bio (only.one/driftnets). This is not the first time we have banded together to stop this archaic and barbaric practice. This time around, let’s make it the last!

Back in 2018, we succeeded in getting California to ban driftnets in state waters by strategically exposing the atrocities committed by the fishing industry. @Paulnicklen remembers what he witnessed off the coast of California as some of the most devastating moments of his career. Everyone was heartbroken and enraged by images of entangled whales, dolphins, seals, and turtles killed by driftnets. We stood together collectively and told the government of California that the deaths of thousands of marine animals is not acceptable, and demanded that they outlaw driftnets. It worked. Governor Jerry Brown of California signed #SB1017 into law to phase out the use of driftnets in the state.

Now, we need the same swell of support to ban driftnets in federal waters because the devastating deathnets are still in use. Did you know ninety percent of dolphins and porpoises killed along the U.S. West Coast and Alaska are killed by driftnets? Earlier this year, Senators Feinstein and @sencapito re-introduced the bill banning driftnets in federal waters — Trump vetoed it the first time around. There’s no doubt that together we can end this! Join the 160,000+ others who have already signed the petition. This simple act of adding your voice absolutely does make a difference.

Video by @Sealegacy. ⁠⁠ 

In collaboration with @seaspiracy and @onlyone.

#driftnets #deathnets #uscongress #onlyone #seaspiracy #oneocean #savetheocean #dolphin #dolphins #petition #pacific #illegalfishing #california

node.title: Stop the deadly use of driftnets!

node.text:
Have you ever wondered what it would be like to go on expedition with @paulnicklen, @mitty, and the @Sealegacy crew? Now’s your last chance to make your dream a reality with our friends at @Omaze! Enter at the link in our bio for an opportunity to come aboard our catamaran, SeaLegacy 1, on the trip of a lifetime! Deadline to enter is August 18, 2021.

This dream trip includes round-trip flights and three nights and four days on board SeaLegacy 1 as it makes its maiden voyage around the world. Snorkel in crystal blue waters teeming with life, learn the ropes of sailing a catamaran, and take the best photos of your life alongside SeaLegacy story tellers with a new Sony® a7C camera, which is yours to keep!

You can choose to make a small donation that goes directly to SeaLegacy’s conservation efforts when entering the contest. Click the link in our bio or go to omaze.com/oceans. Good luck!

⁠ #omaze #omazetrip #dreamtrip #contest ⁠#oceanconservation #tripofalifetime⁠ #turningthetide

node.title: Explore the ocean with Paul and Cristina

node.text:
🔊 All last week, we shared content with you from the Coral Triangle — and now, we want to invite you to come behind-the-scenes of our conservation journey in Timor-Leste, a young nation whose enchanting waters are bursting with an incredible variety of life, where they are making responsible and sustainable ecotourism an ideal way for local communities to support themselves. 

Join @mitty, @paulnicklen, and @andy_mann in the rich marine ecosystem of Timor-Leste for an unforgettable encounter with the goliath of the ocean: the blue whale. 

Shot by @paulnicklen, @mitty, and @andy_mann on @sonyalpha.

#ShotOnSony #BeAlpha #SonyAlpha

node.title: Behind the Scenes: SeaLegacy’s Conservation Journey | Timor-Leste

node.text:
In the final episode of our 'The Bahamas 2019' series, the team spends some time with the locals — Bahamians whose lives and culture revolve around and are dependent on their relationship with the ocean. Yet, the marine ecosystems in The Bahamas remain under constant threat of increased pollution, coastal development, unsustainable fishing practices, and the ever compounding effects of climate change. 

Our team's unforgettable experiences in The Bahamas in the past continue to fuel our dedication to advocating and fighting for the ecosystem and communities here in the present.

⛵ Can't get enough behind-the-scenes action? Well, you're in luck — starting next week, tune in to our stories to see what it's like to be part of the crew aboard The #SeaLegacy1 as we continue to support the needs of Bahamians on the ground over the coming months. #TurningTheTide

***The footage from this series was captured on expedition in early 2019, in a pre-COVID and pre-Dorian world

@paulnicklen @mitty @andy_mann @samkretch @moorecharitable @trevor_bacon1 @ceibahamas

#OnlyOneOcean #Bahamas

node.text:
In today's episode, join the SeaLegacy team on their mission to document a flourishing coral reef as a baseline in The Bahamas.

See with your own eyes what a healthy Caribbean reef system should look like; these reefs and the diverse species inhabiting them, including endangered species, give us hope for the future — and illuminate the life and ecosystems under the sea that need protecting in glaring technicolor.

***The footage from this series was captured on expedition in early 2019, in a pre-COVID and pre-Dorian world

@paulnicklen @mitty @andy_mann @samkretch @moorecharitable @trevor_bacon1 @ceibahamas

#TurningTheTide #OnlyOneOcean #Bahamas

node.text:
After discovering coral damage, pollution, and a distinct lack of predators at some of the reefs in The Bahamas, the SeaLegacy team is starting to question if they will get to see any sharks at all on this expedition.

Watch to see if their luck changes at Mayaguana, one of the most remote places in The Bahamas, where @Andy_Mann hopes he can guide @PaulNicklen and @Mitty on their first encounter with his favorite shark species — the oceanic whitetip.

***The footage from this series was captured on expedition in early 2019, in a pre-COVID and pre-Dorian world

@samkretch @moorecharitable @trevor_bacon1 @ceibahamas @theislandschool 

#TurningTheTide #OnlyOneOcean #Bahamas #TeamShark

node.text:
“We have a 97% failure rate. People think we just show up and know exactly where the animals are… and that’s not how it is.” - @paulnicklen 

On today's behind-the-scenes blast from the past, @paulnicklen, @mitty, @andy_mann, and the team embark on a true on-the-ground exploratory expedition in The Bahamas where they make some disheartening discoveries on a remote reef. 

Part of our job as storytellers is documenting both the beauty and the threats facing our ocean. This type of exploration comes with both victories and struggles, but no matter what we find, there are lessons to be learned and work we can do to keep #TurningTheTide.

***The footage from this series was captured on expedition in early 2019, in a pre-COVID and pre-Dorian world

@samkretch @moorecharitable @trevor_bacon1 @ceibahamas

#TurningTheTide #OnlyOneOcean #Bahamas

node.text:
We want to take you back in time to an unforgettable SeaLegacy expedition to The Bahamas — a past journey that has inspired our dedication to this incredible country and its invaluable ecosystems. The experiences our team had in 2019 are part of the reason the #SeaLegacy1 crew is on the ground there now!

Starting today, we will be sharing our 'The Bahamas 2019: Behind-the-Scenes' series with you. These never-before-seen SeaLegacy Diaries feature white-tip shark encounters with @andy_mann, blue hole filming challenges with @paulnicklen, endangered coral reef discoveries with @mitty, and more. Stay tuned all week — you won't want to miss any of it! 

***The footage from this series was captured on expedition in early 2019, in a pre-COVID and pre-Dorian world

@paulnicklen @mitty @andy_mann @samkretch @moorecharitable @trevor_bacon1 @ceibahamas

#TurningTheTide #OnlyOneOcean #Bahamas

node.text:
Despite pledges by the Ecuadorian government to protect Galápagos, a World Heritage Site and refuge for 3,000 marine species, industrial and unsustainable fishing practices are plundering its waters, devastating this delicate ecosystem. 

We’re calling on Ecuadorian President Lenín Moreno @leninmorenog and President of the National Assembly @cesarlitardo to fulfill their commitment to protect Galápagos and urgently expand the Galápagos Marine Reserve. Please show your support by signing the petition at only.one/galapagos (link in our story) and share!

#masgalapagos #yoestoycongalapagos #galapagos #ecuador

A pesar de las promesas del gobierno ecuatoriano de proteger Galápagos, Patrimonio Mundial y refugio de 3,000 especies marinas, la pesca industrial e insostenible está saqueando sus aguas, devastando este delicado ecosistema. 

Hacemos un llamado al presidente ecuatoriano Lenín Moreno @leninmorenog y al presidente de la Asamblea Nacional @cesarlitardo para que cumplan su promesa de proteger Galápagos y amplíen la Reserva Marina de Galápagos. Muestra tu apoyo firmando la petición en only.one/galapagos (link en story) ¡y por favor comparte!
.
.
.

Special thanks to @dvfernandez and @luksth for narrating and @robertoochoahe for contributing footage to this video. 
.
.
@mission_blue @migramarnet @mas_galapagos2020

node.text:
This decade, we have an extraordinary opportunity to transform the ocean and world as we know it. It's going to take #AllHandsOnDeck to tackle the climate crisis and rebuild ocean life but we know we can do it with you by our side. 

The Tide is a community of more than 4,000 supporters giving what they can each month to help rebuild marine life together. Join The Tide this #GivingTuesday and your donation will be doubled! 

100% of your contributions will support ocean stories, solutions, and campaigns around the world to help create a healthy, abundant ocean. Each month, you’ll see your impact come to life in a personalized monthly report outlining the projects you are supporting. Head to our stories for the link to join today. 

#ProtectSpecies #RestoreHabitats #PreserveSpaces #StopPollution #ReformFisheries #TackleClimateChange

node.text:
URGENT! We need your help! The Bahamian government has granted a license for offshore oil drilling that could start as soon as December 2020.

This project risks devastating the way of life for this ocean nation. Just one accident, one spill, would have dire consequences for both marine systems in the region and for Bahamians who depend on the ocean for their economy, employment, food sources, recreation, and culture. 

Young Bahamian leaders are urging their Prime Minister,  @opmthebahamas, to stop the project, and they need our help. 

“We refuse to stand by while our islands are endangered. We are not an oil nation. We are an ocean nation. It’s our past, our present, and our future."

Together, we can help these young leaders, @alannahvellacott, @laurenaritchie, @catislandkita, and @natureboyniel, Stop Oil Drilling in the #Bahamas.

Head to our story for the link to sign @OnlyOne's petition and learn more at only.one/bahamas

node.title: Stop Oil Drilling in the Bahamas

node.text:
🔊 Please turn up your volume and join @PaulNicklen on a journey to witness the remarkable coastal wolves of British Columbia. // “I am really proud of our small but mighty @SeaLegacy team when I see them create powerful and impactful storytelling pieces. Please watch the entire film and let me know your thoughts. @SeaLegacy and our partners at @RaincoastConservation have a plan to end the commercial trophy hunting of wolves, bears, and wolverines in British Columbia’s Kitlope Conservancy permanently, but we need your help. Two very generous patrons have just confirmed they will donation-match half of the final $100,000 needed to buy up the remaining hunting licenses in the area, which would double the impact of your contribution. A good friend of mine and avid supporter of @SeaLegacy just came in for $20K. Please visit the link in our bio if you want to get involved in pushing this protection over the finish line so we can save this community of wolves.” - @PaulNicklen 🙏💙 

Shot on assignment for @sealegacy with @johnkelseyphoto. Audio and BTS clips by @maxwelhohn, @steve_woods_photography, and @seaforthexpeditions. Edited by @chadrichmond 

#wolf #coastalwolf #bear #wolverine #kitlopeconservancy #BC #canada #fundraiser #conservation #donation #gratitude

node.text:
Today, as Costa Rica and other Central American nations observe their Independence Day, please help us urge the Costa Rican government to move forward with a robust expansion of its marine protected areas, including protection for the Cocos-Galapagos swimway, to provide a safe haven for critically endangered migratory species. Sign the petition at the link in our bio (only.one/etps).

Thousands of people around the world have already joined the campaign calling on the governments of Costa Rica, Colombia, Ecuador, and Panama to establish the world’s first multinational network of marine protected areas in the Eastern Tropical Pacific Seascape. Please add your voice today!

This region is home to vital ocean corridors for migratory species and supports extraordinary marine life and countless coastal communities. Up against pollution, habitat destruction, climate change, and overfishing, it is in urgent need of protection.

Though the region boasts important MPAs—such as those surrounding the islands of Galápagos, Cocos, Malpelo, and Coiba—marine wildlife, especially highly-migratory ones like hammerhead sharks and leatherback sea turtles, does not recognize these invisible borders, and the ocean between the MPAs is completely unprotected and wide open to fishing. Currently, only a small fraction of this important ocean region is designated as protected and there are major gaps between protected areas. We must act now to safeguard their vital migratory corridors.

Photos by @mitty 

#Galapagos #mpas #oceanconservation #ocean #ETPSeascape

node.text:
It’s time for another episode of ‘SeaLegacy: The Voyage’, our new series with @Sonyalpha! We’re always excited to share the details of our ocean expeditions aboard SeaLegacy1 with you, and in our third episode we’ll go behind the scenes of the aftermath of Hurricane Dorian that struck The Bahamas two years ago. Click the link in our bio to watch the latest episode, ‘Return to Abaco’.⁠
⁠
Hurricane Dorian slammed into The Bahamas on September 1, 2019 – it was the most powerful cyclone in its history and left parts of the island nation in ruins. However, amongst the devastation and debris in the aftermath of Dorian is an unshakable community spirit. The people of The Bahamas are not only strong and resilient, they are committed to doing the hard work to restore the extensive damage.⁠
⁠
"In the wake of Hurricane Ida wreaking havoc across the United States recently, it can be difficult to look towards the future with hope and certainty. These massive storms are starting to become the norm, and it’s heartbreaking to see the people who are ultimately the least responsible for the state of our climate today paying the steepest price. As we reflect on the past and the horrific tragedy of one of the worst Atlantic storms on record, let us not forget the future is built on action. So stand with me and take action for our planet. Together, we can rebuild stronger than ever before." @mitty⁠
⁠
Video by @sealegacy⁠
⁠
#expedition #boatlife #sonyalphauniverse ⁠#oceanconservation #thevoyage #turningthetide ⁠ ⁠#thebahamas #bahamas #hurricanedorian

node.text:
Congratulations to Stefan Christmann @christmannphoto, the winner of the Ocean Photography Awards 2021 Collective Portfolio Award! This award goes to the photographer who most convincingly showcases a long-held commitment to ocean conservation through a striking body of work. Supporting conservation efforts through storytelling is the foundation of what we do at @sealegacy, and we’re thrilled to have so many talented and inspired photographers working to drive action for our blue planet.

Photographers were asked to submit a total of ten images taken at any point in their lives – and it was @christmannphoto’s phenomenal portfolio of penguins that ultimately captivated them the most!

Congratulations to all the other finalists in the Collective Portfolio category as well. All the photos are stunning!

Matthew Smith, @mattysmithphoto (second place)

Alex Kydd, @alexkyddphoto (third place)

Steven Kovacs, @steven_kovacs_photography (finalist)

Galice Hoarau, @galice_hoarau (finalist)

Be sure to tune into @ocean_photography_awards IGTV channel on September 16th to see the overall winner of the 2021 Ocean Photography Awards!

#Oceanphotographywards2021 #oceanconservation #photooftheday #turningthetide

node.text:
We have good news about #BristolBay in Alaska. After a strong showing of public support, the Biden administration is moving ahead with plans to restore environmental protections in Bristol Bay, using the Environmental Protection Agency’s authority under section 404(c) of the Clean Water Act.

Home to the world's largest sockeye salmon fishery and one of the most productive marine ecosystems on earth, Bristol Bay is critical to the economic and environmental health of the region. The salmon fishery is valued at more than one billion dollars and provides 20,000 jobs. Most importantly, it’s a fishery that’s sustainable if the ecosystem is allowed to function naturally.

Go to the link in our bio (only.one/act/oceanagenda) to urge President Biden to advance all the components of the U.S. ocean agenda and ensure he follows through on his promises to Bristol Bay.

Photos by @mitty

#Bristolbay #pebblemine #Alaska #Turningthetide #grizzlybear #salmon

node.text:
When chancing upon dolphins in the open ocean, you often hear them before you actually see them.

Sometimes it's the tell-tale "huff" sound created as they break the surface for a breath of air that alerts you to their presence. Other times, it's the resulting splash of an acrobatic leap. And if you're in the water, it might be their distinctive echolocation clicks and whistles you hear first. But no matter how you discover them, it never fails to be a magical and impactful experience — even if you've encountered wild dolphins a hundred (or even a thousand) times.

Drop a 🐬 below if you love these playful, intelligent creatures as much as we do!

Video by @paulnicklen

#dolphins #oceans #bahamas #turningthetide #oceanconservation

node.text:
We are facing the two most profound environmental challenges of our existence — climate change and loss of biodiversity. These threats are especially acute in Antarctica, where warming water, melting ice, and overfishing is pushing ecosystems in the Southern Ocean toward several catastrophic tipping points.

While we work to address the broader issue of climate change, one of the best ways we can safeguard ecosystems immediately is through Marine Protected Areas (MPAs), which have been shown to vastly increase biodiversity, abundance, and ecosystem health, and provide resilience to climate change.

This year, CCAMLR (Commission on the Conservation of Antarctic Marine Living Resources), has the power to create three new marine protected areas to help protect vital ecosystems in the Southern Ocean. The East Antarctic, Weddell Sea, and Antarctic Peninsula MPAs collectively would represent the largest act of ocean protection in history, covering an area roughly the size of the European Union and 1% of the ocean globally.

Visit the link in our bio to join the campaign to #CallOnCCAMLR to protect Antarctica today!

Photos by @mitty

#CallOnCCAMLR #Antarctica #oceanconservation

node.text:
Words and photos by @Mitty // In my lifetime I have travelled to many countries and have encountered more languages than I could ever hope to master. Some of the most exquisite languages I have experienced, however, live in the wild. If you’ve ever heard an orca's call, you know that they communicate using a series of clicks and whistles and pulses. But, did you know that different pods have their own unique dialects, and that resident orcas in British Columbia are more vocal than transients? Transient orcas, like this mother spy hopping in the Salish Sea with her calf, are hunters who feed primarily on marine animals like seals and sea lions, who can hear their vocalizations in the water. This means that transient orcas hunt silently; streaking through the water without breaching or splashing for long periods, to catch their prey off guard. We watched this pod stalk and kill a sea lion over a period of five hours. All @PaulNicklen kept telling me was 'It must be terrifying to have these hunters on your trail!'

#OceanSchool #TurningTheTide #orcas #ocean #conservation #whaletale #beautifulbc #britishcolumbia #canada

node.text:
Today’s the day! It's your last opportunity to sign up for our digital event to #TalkAboutDriftnets with @mitty, @Seaspiracy director @iamalitabrizi, and ecologist and writer @CSafina. Click the link in our bio to RSVP to the discussion taking place at 7:00pm ET. We know you are passionate about banning driftnets in California and we hope to see you there!

Hundreds of dolphins and other marine species are maimed and killed in driftnets every year for the sake of a fishery that has other options available for how it does business. While driftnet fishing has largely been phased out in California's state-controlled waters, it still continues in California's federally controlled waters. In fact, the fishery’s use of driftnets is responsible for 90 percent of the dolphins and porpoises killed along the West Coast and Alaska. Now, we have another chance to put a stop to this practice but we need a swell of public support so that the U.S. Congress gets the message.

Please sign the petition to ban driftnets in federal waters off the coast of California at only.one/driftnets today.  

Photos by @paulnicklen  

#Bandriftnets #Driftnets #Deathnets #California #Dolphins
#EndangeredSpecies

node.text:
Please join us on September 9th at 7:00pm ET for an important conversation to #TalkAboutDriftnets 
with @mitty, @Seaspiracy director @iamalitabrizi, and ecologist and writer @CSafina.  Click the link in our bio to RSVP to the digital event. 

The California driftnet fishery has an estimated 65% percent bycatch rate, making it one of the most destructive fisheries in the world. The last time US Congress passed a bill banning driftnets in California's federal waters, Trump vetoed it. Now, we have a second chance to save threatened and endangered species, like sharks, that are regularly entangled and killed by driftnets. In fact, sharks are one of the most commonly caught, killed, and discarded species. Over the past decade, an estimated 40,000 blue sharks have died. This has to end! Sharks are apex predators and they play a critical role in the health of ocean ecosystems – the food web depends on healthy shark populations to function normally. 

Please sign the petition to ban driftnets in federal waters off the coast of California at only.one/driftnets. 

Photos by @paulnicklen 

#Bandriftnets #Driftnets #Deathnets #California #Sharks #EndangeredSpecies

node.text:
Have you signed up to join our #TalkAboutDriftnets event with @mitty, @Seaspiracy director @iamalitabrizi, and ecologist and writer @CSafina? Click the link in our bio to RSVP to the digital event on September 9th starting at 7:00pm ET. 

We’ll discuss the deadly use of driftnets in California, and why it’s imperative to ban the practice while the species being decimated still have a fighting chance. Deathnets kill everything in their underwater path and represent an era of fishing practices that are completely archaic and unsustainable. It’s high time for the industry to transition away from harmful practices and allow the marine life off California's coast to flourish once again. Dolphins, sharks, whales, sea lions and sea turtles deserve better than dying in a driftnet.

We hope you join us on Thursday to hear more from our speaker panel, including remarks from Senator Dianne Feinstein. Please stand with us to demand that the government of California take a strong stance against driftnets and ban them forever! 

Photos by @mitty

#TalkAboutDriftnets #BanDriftets #Driftnets #Deathnets #California #Swordfish #SeaTurtles #SeaLions  #Whales #Sharks #EndangeredSpecies

node.text:
You have the power to help ban the use of deathnets in California with a single click. Join us on September 9th at 7:00 PM ET for a unique conversation on the deadly use of driftnets with environmental leaders @mitty, @iamalitabrizi, and @csafina. Sign up at the link in our bio to attend the digital event and be sure to sign the petition at only.one/driftnets. Together we can end this! 

Massive driftnets kill everything in their path, including endangered marine life like rare sea turtles, sea lions, whales, and sharks, and as many as 60 other species. None of these animals need to die. This is preventable. 

California banned the practice in state waters, but it continues in federal waters. In 2020, both houses in the United States Congress passed a bill to ban the practice in federal waters, but Trump vetoed the bill. It has now been reintroduced and is being considered in the United States Senate and House. Please add your voice to the growing sell of people demanding that this practice end once and for all and join us on September 9th to learn more. 

#TalkAboutDriftnets #deathnets #California #bandriftnets #endangeredspecies

node.text:
Please sign the petition urging the Costa Rican government to protect critically endangered species in the Eastern Tropical Pacific. Go to only.one/etps to add your voice!

Fishing pressure is increasing in the Eastern Tropical Pacific. For example, in the Galapagos the number of foreign fishing vessels has grown by 400% since 2017. These fishing fleets are wiping out endangered animals through illegal, unreported, and unregulated fishing along critical animal migration routes. Existing MPA’s are insufficient and disconnected. This allows fishing vessels to easily exploit protected areas by luring marine life out with bait. 17% of marine animals, 19% of ray species, 27% of seabird species, and 34% of shark species that migrate in the region are endangered or critically endangered.

A marine animal's journey to find food and reproduce should not be a death sentence. Please add your voice to the petition today!

Video by @robertoochoahe, @samkretch, @paulnicklen, @andy_mann and @shawnheinrichs
